reviews.text: So disappointing
Unbelievable quality falafel and pita. One pita will literally keep you full all day. Whatever toppings you want and they donâ€™t cost extra! A gem.

Dirty  old place and they do not let you use the bathroom  even for costmer but if a police comes in I guess they have no choice
I'll rather give buisness  to someone  who let's me use the rest room

And besides  it needs desperately  a make over it looks like a canteen  I ran in camp

years ago

A new place a new beginning

Hand down the best falafel I've had in the us.
Exactly how I like it! Its not just a business,  its a place where they think of you and want to see you enjoying the food! Very clean and sterile.  Highly recommend!
Very tasty ğŸ˜‹
Outrageously delicious. Lovely staff
The worker is very nasty . He should be trained of how to deal with customers

I have been coming to Falafel Tanami for 10 years. Best falafel anywhere. And lovely owners and staff.

That said, the cleanliness of the dining area is inexcusably messy and dirty. Please hire another staff person to maintain that area.
NEVER place a delivery order with this place. They have never sent the right order and they donâ€™t pick up their phone. If they do they are very very rude
Best Falafel ever!   I guess everyone else also agrees though cuz the lines are pretty long even after they expanded
Delicious food, warm service, will come again.

We have been coming here for years, and we always had great food!! Now we tried their new location!! Food is so outstanding, the service is quick and extremely friendly, and now the cleaner and more spacial location,  it is the only place to eat falafel in NY!

The best falafel Iâ€™ve ever had outside of Israel
And v fairly priced
Delicious food and fresh always.
Great falafel with all the vegetables/accoutrements make a very tasty/incredible/great falafel. Pleasure to eat @ Falafel Tanami (Yemenite style).
Been coming to Falafel Tanami for years.  The food and atmosphere is always great.  The new location is amazing.

Tbh this is the best falafel that I ate in Brooklyn
This place is 10/10
nice
In my opinion then best falafel in NY!!
They are moving so atmosphere was so so. However the food was great and the guy's that served were great. Will definitely go to new location a few blocks away
Best Sabich and falafel in Brooklyn
Just perfect
Hands down the best!
Have experience with stale food
Great experience, falafel is phenomenal. Thank you to staff for their patience.
Amazing
Great falafel balls. cool place.
40% your experience

Falafel Tanami serves the best falafel in Brooklyn and the best falafel I've had in NYC. Their falafel pita is perfectly crispy and fresh on the outside, fluffy and herb-packed on the inside with a green tasty look, bursting with fresh, authentic Middle Eastern flavors.

The sabich plate features creamy eggplant, boiled egg, and tangy pickles that balance beautifully. Their hummus and tahini are silky smooth and made fresh daily. Friendly staff, fast service, and very reasonable prices make this a go-to spot for anyone craving real, delicious Middle Eastern food. If youâ€™re in Brooklyn, this is truly a must-try falafel experience!

Best Israeli falafel in brooklyn
Well priced!

Unbelievably delicious. One of the best dishes Iâ€™ve ever eaten. Got a â€œfalafel plateâ€ and falafel sandwich for $27. Plate came with three plates. 8 falafel balls, two of the best pitas Iâ€™ve ever had, a plate of humus and tahini and a plate of different salads. With cabbage and fries and fried garlic and pickles and more. Amazing.
Kitchen staff is amazing and friendly u come here often enough u can get some extra food to real small business feel and absolutely love the food

Awesome food at reasonable price! Falafels were ğŸ˜‹
The location is a smaller place and bit far further down into Brooklyn but they are moving to new location!
So good?

The best falafel in New York City!
Super original and authentic. The staff is very friendly, the prices are really affordable, and the service is fast and always with a smile.
Highly recommended for anyone looking for real, high-quality Israeli foodâ€”this is the place to go!
I love this place and the staff are friendly and lovely
Excellent service and Excellent food
Flavor exploded in my mouth, food was excellent
Very good taste

Never had such a delicious falafel..
And really great price ğŸ‘

Never had Falafel before. My friend took me & I was skeptical but also excited. Upon arrival you would see that it wasnâ€™t the most up-kept place but donâ€™t let the mom and pop feeling fool you. The falafel pita was sooooo light refreshing flavorful, like I was at lost for words with each bite. I plan on taking a trip VERY SOONâ€¦ NY TIMES was spot on when they said they are the best in the city.

Was curious to try out this place went the first time and absolutely loved it! I underestimated the serving size so I ordered some hummus on the side and just the pita alone left me absolutely STUFFED. Healthy, homemade, simple and delicious. I am officially a regular. Canâ€™t wait to come back!!

HEAVEN HEAVEN HEAVEN! I come
Here roughly once every 1-2 months and Iâ€™m always so impressed by the hospitality! Kind workers who serve well, and the foodâ€¦ honestly no words. Clean, fresh, and always hits the spot. I can not recommend this place enough.
Iâ€™ve brought friends to eat here too, from out of town and months later they still speak about how it was such a highlight for them. Obsessed!! 10/10

I normally despise falafel. I consider them a poor, hard, sad substitute for meatballs. But the falafel here completely changed my mind!!! They were light, small, soft on the inside with just the right crisp on the outside. I never knew falafel could be like this!!

Got a sabich pita and a falafel pita to try both, and separate falafel balls and everything was wonderful. Excellent prices too!!!

The sabich comes with egg. And either pita dish comes with whatever of 11 different things you'd want to load into them - hummus, garlic, pickles, tahini, two different types of cabbage, sourkraut, Israeli salad...

There is an outdoor dining area but it's hot and doesn't look like much. The inside is crammed and chaotic.

Best felafel I've had since leaving Israel! Friendly service, great prices, and quality food! Enjoyed eating outside in the nice weather and washing it all down with strawberry banana juice. Hope to be back soon.

Read about it on Facebook Group took an hour train ride with my daughter. Well worth it . The guys behind the counter were fast and polite they stuff it with generous amounts of falafel and salads. Itâ€™s extremely casual . It was a satisfying falafel sandwich. Will go back soon again . Price was a ok but not cheap. For the space Great job guys

This place serves the best kosher falafel in NYC, hands down! Mouthwatering, soft yet crunchy, savory taste lingers in the mouth for hours. Simply delicious! No pictures because when you eat it, you zone out in blissâ€¦

The sabbich and falafel pita were appetizing. The hot sauce, tahini sauce, eggplants, and french fries all together was an excellent combination. If you're like me with a voracious appetite questioning if you should stop by here, let me answer for you: YES! This is the best place I've visited for this two food items.
Best falafel around! Friendly service:) Prices are decent. I loved the outdoor patio - it was decorated very nicely with flowers. Will definitely be back.

The food was superb. Its freshness and the flavor is unmatched. The line out the door might have overwhelmed the kitchen causing my order to be delayed and people waiting too close for comfort next to the seating, but it was all well worth it for such a flavorful experience! The food was so good that my picture came late and out of focus, but I didn't care... ğŸ˜‰

This place offers authentic falafel pita. Every ingredient used is homemade, they don't use store bought ingredients. The taste is different then a normal NYC falafel pita, it's very tasty and filling. Portion size is very large and they hesitate to put more sauces or salad if you ask. If you are not too hungry then just take their half pita. Staff is also very humble and polite. They offer outdoor seating also which is covered so you can eat if it's raining or snowing.
Delicious food! Must try! Surprisingly I did not know about this place. Falafel, sabich , hummus, salads, everything was so delicious and fresh. Prices are reasonable.

. I highly recommend this place. Staff  is amazing friendly, treat you like family. What else can you ask for
good energy, good vibes and good Falafel.
Amazing crunchy falafel, tangy amba sauce and great personable service! Highly recommend the eggplant.
One of the best Falafel Pita / Laffa I ever had. One of the best in New York! I highly recommend it!! Also Falafel Plate is great! The Eggplant add on is amazing!

food is good. No complaints and kudos for the food for that reason I gave 4 out of 5 for the food. Very similar to Israel. But really they need to clean more often the sitting area. Wow the Fealty sitting area is like the Fealty streets in Bnei Brak. For that reason the atmosphere itself I gave 1 star out of 5. and the final score I gave it 3 out of 5 because of what I wrote about the sitting area.

The falafel here is legit. Take a bite, and it has a nice green color inside, as it should. The fries aren't that great (they should be kept hot or made fresh), but the food is excellent. The owners are courteous and friendly. Save yourâ€¦

5 stars and beyond for customer service! The owners were so nice and courteous. The falafel was decently tasty and filling. It costed $7 for one. The inside of the store is small, and the decor was rich in culture. Just wish they were more strict about covid rules; it felt cramped with so many people inside. Outdoor dining is available.

I will definitely tell my friends about this place and purchase future falafels here! Thank you!

Food is good .
*If you order online for pickup you may as well go and order in store .Its alot cheaper,and you'll end up waiting for them to make your stuff anyway........
(My bill online was $33 instore would have been $21)

*The best Israeli falafel in America*
Very clean and wonderful service,
Very cheap, great atmosphere and homey , quality and professional service and fast, and certainly I will return, you all must visit there, delicious food and very refined,
They have the best falafel in New York. The amazing combination of salad, fried eggplants, pickle and falafel with special tahini sauce and mango sauce!

Placed an order online with uber eats. One hour later and they still have not started to make it. No communication, poor service. Don't give a crap about potential customers. What are the chances ill order another time? Never again.

Update. After angry phone call restaurant said they will make the order in 5 min. Clearly lied as when food arrived it was cold and soggy. Restaurant has no problem being dishonest to customers.

Pleasant atmosphere, nice staff and delicious food!
Knowing that its my first experience with falafel, they made a sweet treat for me.
Thank you guys so much for making my first falafel experience so special!ğŸ¥°
Possibly the best falafel I've ever had...

This is definitely the best Falafel I ever tasted!
And the service is amazing !

Thank you

LOVE THIS PLACE! We drive an hour to come here and so worth the drive!

However what are the timings? We came on a Monday afternoon and it was closedâ€¦

Nice place, with great prices and friendly staff. I went with a friend and they gave him a mask rather than kick him out for not having one. Will surely be coming back. The food was very fresh and tasty with a good texture.
